Qi Yu
Home Publications & Talks Teaching Gallery

Since March 2020, I am working as a PhD student in computational linguistics and a research fellow (Wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiterin) at the Cluster of Excellence "The Politics of Inequality", University of Konstanz. Before that, I received a M.A. in Speech and Language Processing (2019) and a M.A. in General Linguistics (2020) from the University of Konstanz.

My work is part of the project Framing Inequalities, where I focus on the automated detection of framing in print media using Natural Language Processing (NLP) approaches.

PROFESSIONAL INTERESTS

I am passionate about applying machine learning and statistical approaches to explore big data, especially text data. Broadly, my interests include:

  • Text Mining
  • Interpretability and Analysis of Models for NLP
  • Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI)
